ITEM 5. MARKET FOR REGISTRANT’S COMMON E.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 5. MARKET FOR REGISTRANT’S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES in bullet points:

• Our Class A common stock has been listed and traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol “CRWD” since June 12, 2019.

• As of January 31, 2025, we had 95 holders of record of our Class A common stock and zero holders of record of our Class B common stock.

• We have never declared or paid any cash dividends on our capital stock and currently intend to retain all available funds for the operation of our business.

• Our ability to pay dividends is limited by restrictions on our ability to pay dividends or make distributions under the terms of our credit facility.

• On November 20, 2024, we issued approximately $22.8 million of shares of our Class A common stock to certain stockholders of Adaptive Shield in connection with our acquisition of Adaptive Shield.

• The transaction was exempt from registration under Section 4(a)(2) of the Securities Act.

ITEM 7. MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANAL.summary:
Here are the key facts from the MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS section in bullet points:

• CrowdStrike was founded in 2011.
• The company's fiscal years ended January 31, 2025, January 31, 2024, and January 31, 2023 (referred to as fiscal 2025, fiscal 2024, and fiscal 2023).
 
Note: There are no specific financial or operational facts provided in this section.

ITEM 7A. QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DI.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 7A. QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK in bullet points:

• As of January 31, 2025, CRWD had cash and cash equivalents of $4.3 billion.
• As of January 31, 2024, CRWD had cash and cash equivalents of $3.4 billion and short-term investments of $99.6 million.
• A hypothetical 100 basis point change in interest rates would not have had a material effect on the fair market value of CRWD's portfolio as of January 31, 2025 or January 31, 2024.
• The interest rate on CRWD's Senior Notes is fixed.
• A hypothetical 10% adverse change in the U.S. dollar against other currencies would result in an increase in operating loss of approximately $108.3 million for the fiscal year ended January 31, 2025.
• As of January 31, 2024, a 10% adverse change in the U.S. dollar against other currencies would result in an increase in operating loss of approximately $75.8 million and $55.5 million for the fiscal years ended January 31, 2023 and January 31, 2024 respectively.
• CRWD does not believe that inflation had a material effect on its business, financial condition, or results of operations during the fiscal years ended January 31, 2025, January 31, 2024, or January 31, 2023.

ITEM 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEM.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART II - ITEM 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA section:

• The audit was conducted by an independent public accounting firm registered with the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB).
• The audit was performed in accordance with the standards of the PCAOB.
• The auditor's responsibility is to express opinions on the Company's consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting based on their audits.
• The auditor conducted procedures to assess the risks of material misstatement, examined evidence regarding the amounts and disclosures in the consolidated financial statements, and evaluated the accounting principles used by management.
• The audit included evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting based on the assessed risk.
• The auditor believes that their audits provide a reasonable basis for their opinions on the Company's consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting.

2.21.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - 2.21 section in bullet points:

• Total unrecognized stock-based compensation expense related to unvested Special PSU Awards was $11.2 million as of January 31, 2025.
• The weighted-average vesting period for this expense is 1.1 years.
• A total of 3,500,000 shares of Class A common stock were initially reserved for issuance under the CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. 2019 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP).
• The ESPP provides for consecutive offering periods that are approximately 6 months in length and start on June 11 and December 11 of each year.
• Participants may purchase a maximum of 2,500 shares of common stock during a purchase period.
• The purchase price of the shares is 5% of the lower of the fair market value of the Class A common stock on the first trading day of the applicable offering period and the last trading day of each purchase period.

ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES in bullet points:

• As of January 31, 2025, CRWD's management concluded that its disclosure controls and procedures were effective at the reasonable assurance level.
• The effectiveness of CRWD's internal control over financial reporting as of January 31, 2025 was evaluated by management based on the criteria established in Internal Control - Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.
• The evaluation of CRWD's internal control over financial reporting as of January 31, 2025 was audited by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm.
• There was no change in CRWD's internal control over financial reporting identified during the fiscal quarter ended January 31, 2025 that has materially affected or is reasonably likely to materially affect its internal control over financial reporting.
• CRWD's management believes that its disclosure controls and procedures and internal control over financial reporting are designed to provide reasonable assurance of achieving their objectives but acknowledges that no evaluation can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud have been detected.

ITEM 9B. OTHER INFORMATION.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - ITEM 9B. OTHER INFORMATION in bullet points:

• The company's directors and officers adopted a "Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangement" for the sale of shares of Class A common stock.
• The arrangement is intended to satisfy the affirmative defense conditions of Rule 10b5-1(c).
• Mr. Henry will sell 21,330 shares subject to RSUs and 33,003 shares subject to PSUs.
• The actual number of shares subject to PSUs that may be sold is subject to satisfaction of performance conditions.
• Each arrangement is subject to further early termination for certain specified events.
• No other officers or directors adopted a "Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangement" or a "non-Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangement" during the last fiscal quarter.

ITEM 10. DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS A.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART III - ITEM 10. DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE in bullet points:

• The Code of Conduct applies to all employees, executive officers, and directors of CRWD.
• The nominating and corporate governance committee of the board of directors is responsible for overseeing the Code of Conduct.
• Any waivers of the Code of Conduct must be approved by the nominating and corporate governance committee.
• Amendments to the Code of Conduct will be disclosed on the company's website as required by law or listing standards.
